subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Sam Walton: Small-Town Stores That Ate the World
description: Learn Sam Walton: Small-Town Stores That Ate the World in one minute.

hook.text: Sam Walton drove a beat-up pickup truck and flew coachâ€”while running the world's largest retailer.

buildup.text: Walton opened the first Walmart in 1962 in tiny Rogers, Arkansas. Population: 5,700.

discovery.text: His formula: everyday low prices, ruthless cost-cutting, and supply chain innovation.

twist.text: Competitors ignored rural America. Walton built an empire in the towns they overlooked.

climax.text: Walmart became the world's largest company by revenue. A small-town strategy that conquered retail.

punchline.text: The biggest opportunities hide where nobody's looking.

quiz.question: What gave Sam Walton an early competitive advantage?
options: He targeted rural markets that competitors ignored
He offered the widest product selection
